      • getObject

        public T getObject()
        Get the underlying object. The object is dynamically created by the SMR engine.
        Specified by:
        getObject in interface ISMREngine<T>
        Returns:
        The object maintained by the SMR engine.

      • setObject

        public void setObject(T object)
        Set the underlying object. This method should ONLY be used by a TX engine to restore state.
        Specified by:
        setObject in interface ISMREngine<T>
        Parameters:
        object -

      • sync

        public void sync(ITimestamp ts)
        Synchronize the SMR engine to a given timestamp, or pass null to synchronize the SMR engine as far as possible.
        Specified by:
        sync in interface ISMREngine<T>
        Parameters:
        ts - The timestamp to synchronize to, or null, to synchronize to the most recent version.

      • propose

        public ITimestamp propose(ISMREngineCommand<T> command,
                          CompletableFuture<Object> completion,
                          boolean readOnly)
        Propose a new command to the SMR engine.
        Specified by:
        propose in interface ISMREngine<T>
        Parameters:
        command - A lambda (BiConsumer) representing the command to be proposed. The first argument of the lambda is the object the engine is acting on. The second argument of the lambda contains some TX that the engine
        completion - A completable future which will be fulfilled once the command is proposed, which is to be completed by the command.
        readOnly - Whether or not the command is read only.
        Returns:
        A timestamp representing the timestamp that the command was proposed to.

      • checkpoint

        public ITimestamp checkpoint()
                      throws IOException
        Checkpoint the current state of the SMR engine.
        Specified by:
        checkpoint in interface ISMREngine<T>
        Returns:
        The timestamp the checkpoint was inserted at.
        Throws:
        IOException
